        @Nonnull
public JVar varParam(@Nonnull
                    Class<?> type,
                    @Nonnull
                    String name)
        Add the specified variable argument to the list of parameters for this method signature.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the parameter being added.
        name - Name of the parameter being added
        Returns:
        the variable parameter
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this method is called twice. varargs in J2SE 1.5 can appear only once in the method signature.

      • varParam

        @Nonnull
public JVar varParam(int mods,
                    @Nonnull
                    Class<?> type,
                    @Nonnull
                    String name)
        Add the specified variable argument to the list of parameters for this method signature.
        Parameters:
        mods - mods to use
        type - Type of the parameter being added. Is automatically converted to an array.
        name - Name of the parameter being added
        Returns:
        the created variable parameter
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this method is called twice. varargs in J2SE 1.5 can appear only once in the method signature.

      • varParam

        @Nonnull
public JVar varParam(int mods,
                    @Nonnull
                    AbstractJType type,
                    @Nonnull
                    String name)
        Add the specified variable argument to the list of parameters for this method signature.
        Parameters:
        mods - mods to use
        type - Type of the parameter being added. Is automatically converted to an array.
        name - Name of the parameter being added
        Returns:
        the created variable parameter
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this method is called twice. varargs in J2SE 1.5 can appear only once in the method signature.
